title: Delmae student a winner in handwriting contest
title_page: Delmae student a winner in handwriting contest
maintext:
FLORENCE, S.C. – Maliyah Daniels, a kindergarten student at Delmae Heights Elementary School, has been named the state grade level winner in the National Zaner-Blozer Handwriting contest.
Approximately 280,000 students participated this year in the contest. As a grade level winner, Maliyah will be eligible to compete for a Grand National Champion Title.
Maliyah received an engraved Zaner-Blozer State Winner Medallion.
Her teacher, Wendy Singletary, received an engraved glass diamond award.
Delmae received a $100 certificate to be used for purchasing handwriting paper.
“Every year, Delmae students in grades K-4 participate in the National Handwriting Contest because our teachers, families and students believe that neat handwriting is important,” Delmae Elementary Principal Roy Ann Jolley said. “We also enjoy showcasing our students’ handwriting.”
